text: Margaret Heafield Hamilton, (born August 17, 1936) is an American computer scientist, systems engineer, and business owner. She was Director of the Software Engineering Division of the MIT Instrumentation Laboratory. It developed on-board flight software for the Apollo space program.NASA Office of Logic Design "About Margaret Hamilton" (Last Revised: February 03, 2010) On November 22, 2016, she was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom by U.S. President Barack Obama for her work leading the development of on-board flight software for NASA's Apollo Moon missions. ==References== ==Other websites== * MIT News * Margaret Hamilton Video produced by Makers: Women Who Make America Category:1936 births Category:Living people Category:American software engineers Category:Engineers from Indiana Category:Businesspeople from Indiana Category:Presidential Medal of Freedom recipients
title: Margaret Hamilton (scientist)
